snippet: An industry group reported that a growth index based on survey data fell in December 2014, but economists remained optimistic that the slowdown was temporary.
abstract: Institute for Supply Management reports that its service index fell to 56.2 in December 2014, down from 59.3 in November, indicating slowing growth in service sector; Commerce Dept reports that factory orders fell by 0.7 percent in November, fourth consecutive monthly decline.
lead_paragraph: An industry group reported that a growth index based on survey data fell in December 2014, but economists remained optimistic that the slowdown was temporary.

headline.main: U.S. Services Growth Falls to More Moderate Levels
headline.print_headline: U.S. Services Growth Fell to More Moderate Levels in December
